results.title: Lemonheads: two weeks in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jesse Peretz, Catherine Smith and Atlantic
results.brief_description: The independant US band The Lemonheads first received mainstream attention when their album “It’s A Shame About Ray” broke through into the Top 40. We casually follow the band around Australia during the 1992 tour to promote the album. Utilising cinema verite techniques this program includes interviews with the band and live performances of many of their songs. It also features the promotional videos to a number of songs including: “It’s a Shame about Ray”, “Confetti”, “My Drug Buddy” and their unique version of Simon & Garfunkle’s “Mrs Robinson”.

results.title: Lemonade Joe [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Oldrich Lipsky, Jaroslav Jilovec and Filmove Studio Barrandov
results.brief_description: A Czech musical western that spoofs American cinema with obvious affection and demonstrates how the Czech New Wave film movement of the 1960s wasn’t limited to ruminations on the history, politics and art of Eastern Europe. Lemonade Joe (Karel Fiala) is the good-natured lemonade salesman who teams up with a temperance leader, the sweet blond Winnifred (Olga Schoberova), to defeat a local saloon and den of prostitution. With his capitalistic know-how and her ideological piety, they believe that they’ll soon have all of Arizona trading whisky for lemonade. Composed largely in whimsical sing-song rhyme with the characters breaking into song at every opportunity, the dialogue and tunes arise from a uniquely Czech interpretation of the American Western. In Czech with English subtitles.

results.title: Lelong court
results.brief_description: This short humorous docu-drama centres around a foley artist/sound effects specialist, Jean-Pierre Lelong and his role in making a film. Infatuated with the main actress Lelong meddles with the tricks of his trade to become the saboteur in an attempt to prevent the hero from being united with the film’s heroin. Gradually the film’s direction shifts as a result of Lelong’s work, but not with Lelong’s intended results. No spoken word, sound effects only. Cast includes Sylvie Loeillet, Jean-Pierre Lelong and Bernard Bourdeix.

results.title: Leila [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Dariush Mehrjui, Faramarz Farazmand and Farabi Cinema Foundation
results.brief_description: Considered as the founder of modern Iranian cinema, one of Iran’s greatest modern directors (alongside Kiarostami and Makmalbaf) and that country’s “longest-running cinematic master”, Dariush Mehrjui lacks the international profile of his contemporaries. “Leila” is one of just a handful of his films that have achieved recognition and distribution outside of Iran. Set firmly in the urban world of contemporary middle-class Tehran, the film centres on besotted newlywed couple Leila and Reza. Their happy life together begins to unravel after Leila finds herself unable to conceive. While the couple are unconcerned about this development, Reza’s mother is determined that her son have children, and insists that he must take a second wife to produce a heir and continue the family line. When Reza refuses to give in to her demands she turns to Leila, beating down her resistance to the idea with a mix of pleading, haranguing, and lies, until the couple limply gives in. An understated, yet devastating story of a happy union destroyed by the pressures of family and tradition. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: Legs
results.creator_credit: Jerrold Freedman, Ron Parker, Franklin R. Levy, Comworld Productions, Radio City Music Hall Productions and Catalina productions
results.brief_description: Three young hopefuls, Terry (Deborah Geffner), Melissa (Maureen Teefy) and Lisa (Shanna Reed) aspire to become part of the The Radio City Music Hall Rockettes, one of the world’s most famous and glamorous chorus lines. The story revolves around their auditioning, their hard work, successes and failures and of course their romances. Cast also includes John Heard, Sheree North, David Marshall Grant and Gwen Verdon.

results.title: Legionnaire
results.creator_credit: Peter MacDonald, Jean-Claude Van Damme and Edward Pressman
results.brief_description: 1924 - Marseilles, France, and boxer Alan Leferve (Jean-Claude Van Damme) runs foul of a mobster after winning a fight he was supposed to lose, attempts to take the mobsters girlfriend away, and in the ensuing escape finds himself not only running from the mobster henchmen - but the law as well. His only hope is to join the French Foreign Legion, a place where you can forget your name, escape your past, abandon your love and try to survive in the Moroccan desert of North Africa. Now Alain DuChamp, Leferve befriends an Englishman with a military past, an Italian who joined for the money to marry his sweetheart, and an American negro looking for some respect as a man. What unfolds is a story of survival, passionate love and an explosive war saga for all lovers of action and adventure. Cast also includes Adewale Akinnuoye, Daniel Caltagirone, Nicholas Farrell and Steven Berkoff.
